title: Supply Chain Firewall - Events
description: This dashboard provides insights into Supply Chain Firewall Logs.

definition.content:
[Supply Chain Firewall](https://github.com/DataDog/supply-chain-firewall/) is a command-line tool designed to prevent the installation of malicious packages from PyPI and npm. It is primarily intended for engineers to safeguard their development workstations against supply-chain attacks and reduce the risk of compromise during software development.

This dashboard offers a comprehensive summary of package manager installation activities using data from supply chain firewall events.

For more information, see the [Supply Chain Firewall Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/supply_chain_firewall/).

**Tips**
- Use the timeframe selector in the top right of the dashboard to change the default timeframe.
- Clone this dashboard to rearrange, modify and add widgets and visualizations.

definition.content: Datadog Cloud SIEM analyzes and correlates Supply Chain Firewall logs to detect threats to your environment in real time. If you don't see signals please make sure you've enabled [Datadog Cloud SIEM](/security).
